result.execSummary:
The defendant William D. Kletsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: --pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge= $543,  to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 10/7/16 and on the 7th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 11  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

--serve 45  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on   8/19/2016 at 7:00pm

--The Court authorizes service of this Jail term in Dodge County, so long as it is served as it would be in Jefferson County, that is without electronic monitoring or some other passive confinement

--0 days credit for time already served given

--The Court determines that Mr. Kletsch has previously provided a DNA sample. 

-- Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Huber Law/Work Release Notification

Case called at 3:30pm [mo]
Defendant William D. Kletsch in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.  DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 45  days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on   8/19/2016 at 7:00pm
--The Court authorizes service of this Jail term in Dodge County, so long as it is served as it would be in Jefferson County, that is without electronic monitoring or some other passive confinement
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs of $243  plus $200 DNA surcharge plus $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge= $543,  to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 10/7/16 and on the 7th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 11  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

The Court determines that Mr. Kletsch has previously provided a DNA sample. 


DA Happ requests $98 in subpoena fees, the Court denies this request. 
recess: 4:11pm

Case called at 8:34am [mo]
Defendant William D. Kletsch in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

As to the State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements made by the Defendant 
Upon inquiry of the Court, Atty. Hagemann indicates that Defense did submit a response to the State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements made by the Defendant
--The Court rules that the statements made by Mr. Kletsch are admissible at trial

State's Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications:
--the Court makes a factual finding that the Defendant has the prior convictions 
--The Court does rule that for purposes of Trial, Mr. Kletsch has 7 prior convictions

As to Defense's Motion in Limine:
--the Court grants paragraph one, with no objection from the State
--the Court generally grants paragraph two; reserves the right to revisit in manner highlighted by the State
--the Court determines there is a meeting of the minds as to paragraph three
--the Court grants paragraph four
--the Court grants paragraph five, with caveat given by Court

recess: 9:05am
Defendant's Response to State's Notice of Motion and Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications
Motion hearing on July 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion in Limine

State's Notice of Intent to Admit Statements of Defendant
State's Response to Court's Scheduling Order with Proposed Jury Instructions
Conflict Review Worksheet--No Conflict Found
Jury trial on July 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on July 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 11:21am. 
Defendant William D. Kletsch in court.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Kletsch verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $150 Cash Bond (already posted), with added conditions: 
--not to engage in any acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the case with Molly Bellows
recess 11:27am
